profile.about_me:
CURRENT MISSION

Travelling when I can and blogging üòé

ABOUT ME

Hi, I'm Tom-Daniel, the runaway Viking from Norway.

Viking
Just in case you wonder about the Viking part; go back a thousand years and Norway was filled with Vikings whom traveled the world. Hence runaway Viking, except I don't sail in a wooden ship and carry a sword.

Origin of this Viking
I was born and bred in Norway, a cold country in the Northern Europe that's often associated with polar bears, snow and oil.
I grew up in a small city, Hokksund, before I moved to a small village, √Öros, when I was 10 years old. Though I've never been diagnosed with ADHD, I've always had a ton of energy. A feel or restlessness in me. My mother got told on many a teacher-parent meeting that "...you're son is well behaved, polite and stays in his seat, but he hardly ever sits STILL in his seat.". 

I could bore you with my childhood and everything in it, but very much doubt that you'd be THAT interested in all of that. To sum it up in a few short words; I had a normal childhood and a great family around me. Instead I'll focus on the travel- and adventure part of my life.

Travel bug
If there is something that could be classified as a travel bug, I'm pretty sure I've got it. Growing up I liked experiencing new things and places. Didn't have to be something major like flying to the other side of the world, it could be a simple day trip to the closest big city. I owe a lot of the travel experiences in my early childhood to my mom. My mom, being a single mom, did her very best to ensure that I'd have all the same experiences like any other kid. She worked hard so that I'd have the opportunity to travel and experience new things.
Besides going to Sweden at least once a year, I went to Greece for the first time when I was 8. I remember all the new tastes, smells, language and culture. During that holiday, I picked up a fair few Greek words. I was smitten. Smitten with travel.
Why travel?
‚ÄúTravel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness.‚Äù ‚Äì Mark Twain
That quote by American author Mark Twain, pretty much sums up the advantages of travelling in one single sentence. By knowing other types of cultures, languages and people you become rich. Rich on knowledge, the best kind.

Ever since I saw Eurotrip (2004) I was hooked with the idea of travelling. Of living in the now. From the first time I watched that film I knew I wanted to travel. After three amazing years in college (US: high school) in Norway, I went on to study at Swansea Metropolitan University in Wales (UK). There I met some of the most amazing people whom I became incredibly close to. I gained a second family there.

But there is also another reason why I decided to really go for it now. In January 2013 I had an accident which resulted in me having surgery, six weeks in a cast and three months of physio. Anyway, not going to sob over that. Stuff happen. But that experience kinda changed me. Even though the accident was far from fatal, I got a scare. In April my physiotherapist said that if I don't keep up a high activity level, I might not never be able to fully run again. That message, shocked me and pushed me towards my plan of travelling! After a year of adventures in Australia and New Zealand, becoming the first Norwegian to cross Australia by bike, I returned to Norway and volunteered for one year military service. 
After my year ended, I was offered a civilian contract with the Norwegian Armed Forces Media Centre. Loving my job and travel when I can! Wish I could do more travelling... 

PHILOSOPHY

#YOLO
Stop trying to please everyone. You can't make an omelet without cracking a few eggs, so stop trying. Live your life the way you want it.

I've come to realise that life is too short and you simply have to make the most of it. Who knows what will happen tomorrow?
profile.media:
I love sci-fi, fantasy, action and thriller movies and TV series, with the occasional drama in between it all.

My absolute favourite book (series) is the Narnia Chronicles and I've got a tattoo to prove it. Besides that The Hunger Game series, Lorien Legacies and Harry Potter series.

As for music, I'm quite diverse. I'm open to most things, all depends on the beat really. I love P!nk and Katy Perry, but at the same time enjoy ACDC and Eminem.
profile.teach: Everybody and nobody! Open to most. Trying out and learning about new cultures is probably the best thing one can do. Learning.
profile.amazing_thing:
Spending time on one of my favourite European islands; Crete! The colours, smells...everything; amazing!

Travelling to New Zealand and going to Waiheke island, an absolutely paradise.

Becoming the first Norwegian in history to cross Australia by bike.
profile.surf_reason:
HOW I PARTICIPATE IN COUCHSURFING

I initially got involved back in 2009 as part of the translating team (English to Norwegian). Later I've shown surfers around places I've lived in and given them tips.

COUCHSURFING EXPERIENCE

Been to a few CS events + "surfed" in Australia. Also met up with a couple of surfers in Europe to show them around the city I was living in and give recommendations on where to go and what to do.
profile.offer_hosts:
- Meet up with you in Oslo when possible
- Give some advice on what to see and do in Oslo

couch.couch_description: Not able to host at the moment due to current living arrangements, but more than happy to meet up with you in Oslo and give you a tour and/or tips of the local area.

messages.body:
SUBJECT: Welcome

Hey :)


First things first, my name is Frederico and I'm a
Lisbon CS Ambassador - My profile:
http://www.couchsurfing.com/people/fc-lx-73. This
message is to welcome you in CS !! So... WELCOME !!


I'm glad you found us.

I know that you are a newbie arround here so you must
have all this questions about CS... is it safe? how
does it work? do I have to say yes to everyone? and so
on and so on... well... that's our job! To try to
answer all your doubts and questions about this
amazing comunity!


One of the first things you should do is to invest in
your profile as much as you can. Put all the info you
can remember off, pictures off yourself, stories,
places you've been, things you've done, stuff you like
and so on... this will help other members to get to
know you before they do face to face.

I imagine that everything is quite new to you in the
site, so you should surf through the site for a while
and if you have any questions, feel free to contact me
and I'll answer as soon as possible! I've had amazing
experiences on CS, everytime I surf someone's couch is
like visiting an old time friend - imagine how cool
this is!

Because we share the fact that we are both Couch
Surfers, and this is enough to imidiatly feel at
ease.I hosted so many people allready but I still can
remember every single one of them, some relaxed
easy-going travelers just absorbing every experience
with out plans to fast travelers with a crazy desire
to see as many places as possible in a short period of
time... You name it I've seen it all... CS atracts
adventurouse and open minded people, this shows you
that the world is still a beautifull place and that
human beeings can really hold hands and help each
other to enjoy life at the most.

Once I saw this writing in a wall in Lisbon that I
thing that summons preety much the feelings you will
face in the near future : "Parfois on a l'impression
qui on va faire un voyage, mais c'est le voyage que
nous fait!" signed by Paco.Through CS you will learn
and experience so many new things... stuff about
countries, cities, people and so on... and all from
personal experience!

Well... this is going to long for a greeting mail, so I
sugest you read this guidelines:
- About CouchSurfing -
http://www.couchsurfing.com/about.html ;
- Some tips - http://www.couchsurfing.com/tips.html ;
- CS Groups - http://www.couchsurfing.com/groups.html


Have fun !! I know I do :)

Your friend


Fred

Translation - General is the umbrella group for all
active translation work teams.

To join us, please contact the Team Leader of the
appropriate language team:
wiki.couchsurfing.com/en/Language_Team_Leaders

Members of this group can use the online translation
tool to translate the Couchsurfing website, and
casually help translate member communications as
needed for projects.

Translation Guide

is available on the CS wiki. Please update your
bookmarks and read those two pages with attention:

improve and can't do it without each and everyone's
help!

tracker (Mantis) please ask in the group!

SUBJECT: Rural Couchsurfing

Hei

Dette er en invitasjon til deg som bor utenfor v√•re
st√∏rste byer og tettsteder. Som du/dere sikker har
lagt merke til har byer st√∏rre attraksjon for surfere
enn steder som ligger langt fra allfarvei. Det er det
samme over hele verden. De som bor i byer drar til seg
majoriteten av de reisende. P√• CS f√•r det den
effekten at de som bor i byer blir over√∏ste med
sofaforf√∏relser, mens vi som bor p√• landet f√•r ingen
eller f√•. Om du er et medlem som √∏nsker deg flere
bes√∏k p√• sofaen, s√• er dette opplegget beregnet p√•
deg:

Rural Couchsurfing.

Det finnes medlemmer av Couchsurfing som foretrekker
andre m√•ter √• reise p√• enn √• hoppe fra en storby
til den neste. De som er mer interessert i √• finne det
genuine av at land og som vil treffe vanlig mennesker i
deres hverdag, de som liker n√¶rhet til natur, sj√∏ og
kyst. Derfor finnes det grupper for de som bor og tar i
mot gjester utenfor byer og tettsteder. Du kan lese mer
om tanken bak Rural Couchsurfing p√• CS-Wiki p√• denne
linken:

http://wiki.couchsurfing.com/en/Rural_CouchSurfing

Det finnes allerede en gruppe som handler om rural (det
motsatte av urban) med diskusjoner p√• engelsk:

http://www.couchsurfing.org/group.html?gid=9949

N√• starter vi ogs√• en undergruppe (subgroup) til
denne som vi kaller Rural Couchsurfing ‚Äì Scandinavia.
Derav innledningen til dette brevet. Vi sender dette
brevet til alle profiler vi klarer √• finne som stemmer
med ordet rural og som bor i Danmark, Norge eller
Sverige, til deg som bor p√• landet, i mindre byer
eller tettsteder. Vi inviterer deg til √• bli med i
denne gruppen som er beregnet p√• at folk som s√∏ker
etter profiler utenom tettstedene skal lettere finne
din profil. Dessuten kan du komme i kontakt med andre
couchsurfere som ogs√• bor i grisgrendte str√∏k eller
p√• landet. Dette konseptet ble f√∏rst utviklet i
Frankrike og siden i Spania og Portugal og n√• finnes
det ogs√• i Australia. De har liknende undergrupper
under Rural Couchsurfing p√• samme m√•te som for
Skandinavia. Disse gruppene har dessuten laget google
kart som viser hvor de forskjellige medlemmene bor.
Dette har f√∏rt til at medlemmene har f√•tt betydelig
flere foresp√∏rsler og flere gjester. (√Ö v√¶re med p√•
dette kartet er selvf√∏lgelig frivillig for den
enkelte). Du kan se et slikt kart her:

http://maps.google.com/maps/ms?hl=en&ie=UTF8&t=p&msa=0&ll=46.920255,3.427734&spn=13.657503,28.300781&z=5&msid=1131440555289295464
46.0004605cd5254b0b0620c

S√• om dette er interessant for deg, bli med i v√•r nye
gruppe for ‚Äùrural Skandinavia‚Äù s√• fortsetter vi
diskusjonen der. NB. Du kan godt poste p√• dansk, norsk
eller svensk i denne gruppen, men vi forst√•r
selvf√∏lgelig ogs√• engelsk. Du blir medlem ved √•
klikke p√• denne lenken:

http://www.couchsurfing.org/group.html?gid=24544

Velkommen p√• landet!

Hilsen Bente og Lars

SUBJECT: Re: Why New Zealand?

Hi Kasia,

New Zealand is a beautiful country, but I don't think I would move here to study. I'm staying in NZ for 6 months before I move on to Australa.

Don't get me wrong, people are nice here, it's stunning nature and relaxed lifestyle, but it can get a bit boring after a while. Because NZ is a small country and far away from everything.

I would recommend you to study in Australia instead, in Melbourne or Brisbane. Then you can come to NZ to visit.

Like I mentioned, I'm leaving NZ soon and I can't wait to get out of here, haha! That's my personal opinion.

Hope that helps :)

Have a nice day!

written_references.body: Stayed with Vib and her husband Rick for one night and it was great. Though I only spent less than a day with them, they really opened up to me and made me feel welcome :) Hopefully I'll see them again in the future!

Lucinda (and her cousins) hosted me for one night when I was heading through Manjimup as part of my charity cycle across Australia. Though I was only there for a short time, she opened up her beautiful home to me for one night :D Well rested and fed, I headed on towards my next stop!

I came rolling into Albany late after a long long cycle from Warpole, so to make it easy for me she put on the Christmas lights on her balcony. She opened up her great home to me and gave me a home for a few days. She took the time to chat and also include me (and another surfer staying) in her plans :D After a few days, rested and geared up, I said bye to her and her lovely kids. Hopefully I'll see her again some time in the future!

I stayed with Nicole for almost a week on my journey crossing Australia on a bike. She was a great host and showed me so much of Esperance. They beaches are truly stunning! We had some great laughs and truly enjoyed my time there. Hopefully we'll see each other again in Europe :D

John and his daughter are great people, felt welcome straight away. I cannot thank John enough for his help on my charity ride across Australia, Perth to Brisbane. He helped set up interviews, motivate me to keep going, creative ideas, but above all made feel at home. I truly wish them the very best and hopefully I'll see them back in Europe :D

I met Oliver when I was living in Wales (UK). He was working with my mates son and we became friends. I know him to be an outstanding guy, feet well planted in the real world and a really caring guy. I wish him the very best on his travels around the world and hope to see him either in Norway (where I currently reside) or in Wales sometime in the future.

I stayed one night with Federico and Erik whilst I was in Luxembourg. Such a nice couple! Federico met me by the station after he finished work and we walked up to their flat. Lovely place! We spent the evening just talking about cultures, politics and life in general. In the morning Federico and I went for a run in the park and around the city. Both him and Erik had great knowledge of the city, so I got to see stuff that maybe a regular tourist wouldn't see. Would happily stay with them again and I really hope to see them in my home country, Norway, some time in the future! :)

A while back I created a public trip on CS of my journey around south of France. When I was still up in the national park a few days ago, S√©bastien sent me a nice message and said it was a shame he would miss me as he quite likes Norse mythology and wished me a pleasant journey. But I needed a place to crash for my last night before heading to Rome, so he offered to host me. He took me sightseeing around Antibes (beautiful city) and we went for a few beers. Then spent the rest of the time chatting about France, Norway and life. Really great guy, so knowledgeable about this region. I would happily stay with him again and  he's more than welcome to stay with me in Norway üòÉüëç

received_references.body: My cousins and I hosted Tom when he came through Manjimup, raising money for clown doctors on a bike ride across Australia. He's a great guy and very inspiring - we can't believe how far he is going! Glad to be able to give you a "bag of bananas", a bit of apple cake and a hot shower Tom, and sorry we weren't able to spend a bit more time conversing. :) good luck with the trip and here's hoping for a tailwind across the Nullabor!

Tom and I got on like a house on fire! He was very easy to host and was very respectful. He cooked me dinner and we went out for a few beers!! His trip for charity is amazing - he's a true inspiration. I'd host Tom again for sure - and I'm looking forward to meeting him in Norway soon! :)

Tom-Daniel is a well educated, worldly and respectful young man who was always willing to help. Tom was no trouble to host, and gave us an incredible cultural experience. The short time we shared was a very positive couchsurfing experience. 

He is very easy going, and would be the most inspirational person we have met. The world really is this young man's oyster. A true pleasure to host and we hope to meet again. I would not hesitate in recommending you open your doors to him.

It's been a pleasure to host him at our place, he is a very polite and smart guy. We  talked about many different things and also has the opportunity to go running in the park (don't call him out, he's really  well trained! üí™üèª). I wish you a nice trip all around the Europe, in case you pass through Luxembourg just drop us a message :)

Tom stayed with us just before his Norseman and then Nullabor leg of his ride across Australia! Tom was great to host, he is friendly, funny and a very optimistic person. Riding across Australia for charity says a lot about what kind of a person he is! He is wise beyond his years and had HEAPS of information to share with me for my coming trip and I thank him for that :)I hope we cross paths again in the future
Hosted for one night. Tom was friendly, considerate and an easy person to host. Had a great easy flowing conversation and I wish him well on his journey.
Hosted Tom-Daniel for 1 night.It was a pleasure to have him and learn about his challenge to cycle across Australia and raise money for his charity. We would welcome him any time in our home.

I'm happy that I met Tom, we shared the passion for Vikings, he was clean, knowledgeable  and always kept me in touch about his schedule. 
I'd be happy to host him again !

events_attended.name: NZ Awesome Weekly Drinks
events_attended.description:
Back in Late 2008, a German lady and two guys(one French, the other, NZ Sikh), started a CS bar gathering that would eventually fall on every Wednesday of the week...ever since those days, a handful of committed CS members have kept it running and shaped it into the Epic Weekly event that it is Today!

Bienvenido, –¥–æ–±—Ä–æ –ø–æ–∂–∞–ª–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å, Benvenuto, Selamat Datang, ho≈ügeldiniz, ◊ë◊®◊ï◊ö ◊î◊ë◊ê, Willkommen, ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§ó‡§§, Bienvenue, ‘≤’°÷Ä’´ ’£’°’¨’∏÷Ç’Ω’ø, Welcome and Kia Ora!

The drinks is where we all come to hang out, chat, exchange tips and contacts. There's always a great mix of people, locals, travellers, seasoned and new couchsurfers plus their friends. It's the perfect place for people to share travel stories, ideas for NZ and world travel, even create new travel plans and find out about the CS activities planned.

The current venue(for over 2 years)is Bungalow 8: http://www.bungalow8.co.nz/

The Location of bar is across the road from 115 Customs Street West, next to Sierra Cafe(near corner of Market Place)

The bar staff have given Couchsurfers a great deal - $5 for bottled beers, House wine and Spirits, a couple of free food platters for everyone to enjoy plus if you arrive before 8pm, the CS hosts of the night will give you a voucher to claim a drink for free!
NOTE: Be sure to bring your Passport(alt, a NZ Drivers or 18+ card), as the bar is legally required to check if you look under 25 and can not serve you if they can't verify your age.

If you happen to find your way to the drinks, be sure to look out for the host/s of the night. They'll happily Greet you and help get you settled in for the evening festivities. They are also there to give advice and to ensure the CS values are upheld: https://www.couchsurfing.org/n/guidelines
If you feel anyone isn't following these guidelines, don't hesitate to tell a host and they'll make sure the person breaching them, is either remanded or in an extreme case, banned from the event.

If anyone needs help in finding there way on the night or just want to chat with the organisers , then don't hesitate to contact Jamali +64220292857, Aaron Herber: +64277158418, Vikram Aditya: +642102834877 or myself(Thomas): +64226729934

See you all there!

PS, for those that wanna check out photos or share your own from the night, you can do so via our facebook community group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/284964899908/photos/

groups.title: Drammen
groups.description:
Drammen is a city where it is easy to get in touch with people. The city has mainly been build up around wood industry and has had a reputation of being lowbred.

The late years, Drammen has been refurbished. The paper mills are gone, the river has been cleaned up and there are a lovely outdoor area with parks along the riverbanks for several miles. There are still industry, and Drammen is one of the most important stock goods harbours in Norway. 

Drammen is located only 40 km west of Oslo. 
It is not the location if you want to know the most spectacular parts of norwegian nature. But it is a good place to stay if you will get to know the real Norway.

For more information about Drammen, check these links:

-Drammen Wikipedia pages

http://visitdrammensregionen.no
http://www.drammenturistkontor.no
http://www.drammen.no

-----

The former CS Oslo Parties Google Calender has, as off
today, been extended to cover not just Oslo, but also
the regions around Oslo: Akershus and Buskerud. And
that of course includes Drammen.

To view what is happening around you bookmark the
following link in your browser to have easy access and
never ever miss a gathering!
 

Check the  to find out about CS meetings, events, and more in OSLO and the bigger areas of Oslo including Buskerud and Akershus!

This is group for anyone who finds themself saying, ¬®What am I doing with my life?¬® Here's to the wanders, the dreamers and the completely lost.

groups.title: Gold Coast
groups.description:
The Gold Coast stretches from Yatala in the North down to the Tweed and the New South Wales border in the South. The area around Surfers Paradise is the most heavily populated and developed region and is one of the fastest growing areas in Australia.

Surfers Paradise is the center of our city although its mostly a place for tourists so get down to Burleigh Heads or Kirra to experience the real Gold Coast.

For travellers interested in meeting people in specific age groups this link will take you to the age groups home 


For people travelling with vans or something else to sleep in (or for those who can offer a driveway or backyard space for said vans) check out the  Campervan group

groups.title: Gold Coast *URGENT COUCH* Requests
groups.description: This Group if for HOSTS in the Gold Coast who are Happy to Receive *Last minute* Couch Requests. Who are actively Hosting, who are willing to receive couch requests publicly.

groups.title: *Brisbane Last Minute and Emergency Couches*
groups.description:
This group exists to provide a space for travellers to request a last minute or emergency couch if they are caught in a situation whereby something has misfired and they are left stranded with no place to stay in Brisbane.

 Please remember that posting in this group does not guarantee you a couch. It is important to always have a Plan B.

Before joining and posting to the group, please ensure you have read and understood the "Group Guidelines".

In your reason for joining:
Hosts ‚Äì please mention that you are a host
Surfers ‚Äì please tell us what dates you are in Brisbane and need a couch

In your message title, please include the dates you need a couch ‚Äì it will make it much easier for hosts to quickly see whether they are available to host you and increase the likelihood of your post being read.

Always remember, your safety is more important than hosting someone who appears to be in distress or finding a free couch. Please make sure you have read people‚Äôs profiles and references before offering or accepting a couch.

If your travels bring you to Brisbane in more than a few days time, it is neither last-minute nor an emergency: Do not post here. You are much more likely to have success finding a host with whom you will get along well and have fun if you search for people with profiles that appeal to you and mail them directly using using the "Couchsurf with" button. Try to use the tips from Finding and Requesting a Couch and How to write a CouchRequest (deutsch/italiano) to help improve your chances. You can also try using the new Itinerary tool to create an open CouchRequest for each city that you plan to visit so that hosts can search for you and send you invitations.

Occasionally this group will be cleaned up (i.e., people who have left Brisbane will be removed). You are always welcome to rejoin.

Good luck and enjoy Brisbane !

public_trips.description:
Perth is the starting point for my cycle journey across Australia, 5800 KM, raising money for charity.
Perth - Norseman - Nullarbor - Port Augusta - Adelaide - Melbourne - Canberra - Sydney - Brisbane.

I'm hoping to spend a few days in Perth to get all the equipment sorted, double check plans and of course see the city.

From April to August I'm cycling across Australia, from Perth to Brisbane. A journey over 5900 km. This I do raise money for Clown Doctors Australia, helping kids in children's wards.

About me: I'm a 22 year old Norwegian travelling down under. For the past seven months I've been living and travelling around New Zealand. Now it's time for Australia.

I love travelling and this summer the plan is to go on a interrail journey around Europe. First stop is Amsterdam! I¬¥ve always wanted to visit the Netherlands. Staying here three nights before moving on. Hoping to see local sights, museums, street art, quirky shops and interesting people. I¬¥m not TOO big on going out partying... I¬¥m more of a "pint-in-pub-talking" kinda guy, having fun and full on interesting conversations.

See ya!

So if anyone wants to join and split the cost of petrol and experience some stunning scenery together, drop me a message!

See ya!

Hello there üòÄ I'm currently on an Interrail adventure across Europe and I'm heading to Rome. You can read more about on my profile, so don't see the point in mentioning everything here.
But to summarise myself:
- Norwegian
- Pationate about photography
- Prefer local sights over touristy stuff
- Love to meet new people and learn about their culture and language

I've already got a hostel booked, but don't mind cancelling it if someone is offering a couch. If not, I'd love to meet some locals and get their take on the city.

Cheers!

Tom
